acdPort.name: acdPort

revisions.description: Initial version of MIB module ACD-PORT-MIB.

acdPort.contactinfo: Accedian Technical Assistance Center Accedian Networks, Inc. 4878 Levy, suite 202 Saint-Laurent, Quebec Canada H4R 2P1 E-mail: support@accedian.com
acdPort.description: The Port statistics for this Accedian Networks device.

acdPortConfigIndex.name: acdPortConfigIndex
acdPortConfigIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies this acdPortConfig entry.

acdPortConfigName.name: acdPortConfigName
acdPortConfigName.description: This is a string to identify the port.

acdPortConfigAlias.name: acdPortConfigAlias
acdPortConfigAlias.description: This is a string to give the port an alias.

acdPortConfigMacAddress.name: acdPortConfigMacAddress
acdPortConfigMacAddress.description: The MAC address of the port.

acdPortConfigConnectorId.name: acdPortConfigConnectorId
acdPortConfigConnectorId.description: This object identifies the connector ID of the port. This object shall identify the acdDescConnectorID object, defined in the ACD-DESC-MIB.

acdPortConfigMtu.name: acdPortConfigMtu
acdPortConfigMtu.description: The configured MTU of the port. The value ranges from 1518 to 10240.

acdPortConfigAutoNegoState.name: acdPortConfigAutoNegoState
acdPortConfigAutoNegoState.description: Enable or disable the auto negociation on the port.

acdPortConfigSpeed.name: acdPortConfigSpeed
acdPortConfigSpeed.description: The configured speed of the port in Mbps. The valid values are 10, 100, 1000 and 10000.

acdPortConfigDuplex.name: acdPortConfigDuplex
acdPortConfigDuplex.description: The configured duplex mode for this port.

acdPortConfigMdi.name: acdPortConfigMdi
acdPortConfigMdi.description: The configured MDI mode for this port.

acdPortConfigPauseMode.name: acdPortConfigPauseMode
acdPortConfigPauseMode.description: The configured pause mode for this port.

acdPortConfigAdvertisement.name: acdPortConfigAdvertisement
acdPortConfigAdvertisement.description: A value that identifies the set of port capabilities to advertise during auto-negociation. Each bit indicates whether or not the specific capability is valid on the system.

acdPortStatusIndex.name: acdPortStatusIndex
acdPortStatusIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies this acdPortStatus entry.

acdPortStatusSpeed.name: acdPortStatusSpeed
acdPortStatusSpeed.description: The current speed of the port in Mbps. The valid values are 10, 100 1000 and 10000.

acdPortStatusDuplex.name: acdPortStatusDuplex
acdPortStatusDuplex.description: The current duplex mode of the port.

acdPortStatusMdi.name: acdPortStatusMdi
acdPortStatusMdi.description: The current MDI mode of the port.

acdPortStatusTxPause.name: acdPortStatusTxPause
acdPortStatusTxPause.description: Indicates whether or not the port is transmitting pause frames.

acdPortStatusRxPause.name: acdPortStatusRxPause
acdPortStatusRxPause.description: Indicates whether or not the port is receiving pause frames.

acdPortStatusLinkPartnerAbility.name: acdPortStatusLinkPartnerAbility
acdPortStatusLinkPartnerAbility.description: A value that identifies the set of port capabilities advertised by the link partner. Each bit indicates whether or not the specific capability is valid on the link partner system.

acdPortStatusLinkStatus.name: acdPortStatusLinkStatus
acdPortStatusLinkStatus.description: Indicates if the port link is Up or Down. Down(FALSE), Up(TRUE)

acdPortStatusMedia.name: acdPortStatusMedia
acdPortStatusMedia.description: A value that uniquely identifies the selected media type.

acdPortStatusIsMonitor.name: acdPortStatusIsMonitor
acdPortStatusIsMonitor.description: Indicates if the port is a monitor port. No(FALSE), Yes(TRUE)

acdPortStatusIsManagement.name: acdPortStatusIsManagement
acdPortStatusIsManagement.description: Indicates if the port is a management port. No(FALSE), Yes(TRUE)

acdPortStatusIsSFP.name: acdPortStatusIsSFP
acdPortStatusIsSFP.description: Indicates if the port has an SFP. No(FALSE), Yes(TRUE)

acdPortStatusIsFiber.name: acdPortStatusIsFiber
acdPortStatusIsFiber.description: Indicates if the port is connected to fiber. No(FALSE), Yes(TRUE)

acdPortTxStatsIndex.name: acdPortTxStatsIndex
acdPortTxStatsIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies this acdPortTxStats entry.

acdPortTxStatsSupportBits.name: acdPortTxStatsSupportBits
acdPortTxStatsSupportBits.description: A value that identifies the set of TX statistics supported by the device. Each bit indicates whether or not the specific statistic value is valid on the system.

acdPortTxStatsBytesGood.name: acdPortTxStatsBytesGood
acdPortTxStatsBytesGood.description: This is a count of the total number of bytes transmitted by the port in good packets. The count includes the 4 CRC bytes but does not include the preamble or SFD bytes. A good packet is one that has been transmitted successfully (not aborted) with a good CRC. It is assumed that all transmit packets are properly sized, 64 bytes (after any padding) to maxsize bytes long.

acdPortTxStatsBytesTotal.name: acdPortTxStatsBytesTotal
acdPortTxStatsBytesTotal.description: This is a count of the total number of bytes transmitted by the port in good and bad packets. The count includes the 4 CRC bytes but does not include the preamble or SFD bytes. Bad packets include normal collisions, late collisions, and FIFO underflows. For collisions, all bytes transmitted before the start of the collision as well as the colliding and jam bytes are counted. For FIFO underflows, all bytes actually transmitted are counted.

acdPortTxStatsUnicastPkts.name: acdPortTxStatsUnicastPkts
acdPortTxStatsUnicastPkts.description: This is a count of the good unicast packets transmitted by this port. Good unicast packets are packets that are not dropped and have a good CRC. Unicast packets are identified by having a 0 in the least significant bit of the first byte of the destination address (i.e. the first bit transmitted is a 0).

acdPortTxStatsMulticastPkts.name: acdPortTxStatsMulticastPkts
acdPortTxStatsMulticastPkts.description: This is a count of the good multicast packets transmitted by this port (good means not dropped and valid CRC). Multicast packets are identified by having a 1 in the least significant bit of the first byte of the destination address (i.e. the first bit transmitted is a 1). Broadcast packets are not included in this count.

acdPortTxStatsBroadcastPkts.name: acdPortTxStatsBroadcastPkts
acdPortTxStatsBroadcastPkts.description: This is a count of the good broadcast packets transmitted by this port (good means not dropped and valid CRC). Broadcast packets are identified by a destination address of all 1.

acdPortTxStatsPauseFrames.name: acdPortTxStatsPauseFrames
acdPortTxStatsPauseFrames.description: This is a count of the good flow control pause packets transmitted by this port (good means not dropped and valid CRC). Flow control pause packets are identified by a type of 0x8808 and an opcode field of 0x0001.

acdPortTxStatsTaggedFrames.name: acdPortTxStatsTaggedFrames
acdPortTxStatsTaggedFrames.description: This is a count of the good VLAN packets transmitted by this port (good means not dropped and valid CRC). VLAN packets are identified by a type field equal to 0x8100 in the outer VLAN tag.

acdPortTxStatsCRCErrors.name: acdPortTxStatsCRCErrors
acdPortTxStatsCRCErrors.description: This is a count of the transmitted packets with a bad non-appended CRC field. This count doesn't include any packets with a bad CRC due to a FIFO underflow.

acdPortTxStatsDeferred.name: acdPortTxStatsDeferred
acdPortTxStatsDeferred.description: This is a count of the number of packets that were deferred on the first transmit attempt due to the medium being busy. Packets with subsequent deferrals (for instance, after a collision back off) are not counted. Whether the packet is eventually transmitted successfully or not is irrelevant to this counter. Packets dropped due to excess deferral that occur during the initial transmit attempt are not counted.

acdPortTxStatsExcessiveDeferrals.name: acdPortTxStatsExcessiveDeferrals
acdPortTxStatsExcessiveDeferrals.description: This is a count of the number of packets dropped by this port due to excessive deferral. The deferral time starts at the beginning of each transmission attempt and ends when the transmission starts (regardless of collisions). The deferral is excessive if more than 3036 byte times have passed without the transmission starting.

acdPortTxStatsSingleCollisions.name: acdPortTxStatsSingleCollisions
acdPortTxStatsSingleCollisions.description: This is a count of the number of times a packet is successfully transmitted from this port after experiencing a single collision. This count does not include erroneous (dropped) packets.

acdPortTxStatsMultipleCollisions.name: acdPortTxStatsMultipleCollisions
acdPortTxStatsMultipleCollisions.description: This is a count of the number of times a packet is successfully transmitted from this port after experiencing multiple collisions. This count does not include erroneous (dropped) packets and also does not include packets dropped due to excess collisions.

acdPortTxStatsExcessiveCollisions.name: acdPortTxStatsExcessiveCollisions
acdPortTxStatsExcessiveCollisions.description: This is a count of the number of packets dropped by this port due to excess collisions (number of collisions equals MaxRetry+1). This count does not include packets dropped due to FIFO underflow or late collisions (even if the late collision is also an excessive collision).

acdPortTxStatsLateCollisions.name: acdPortTxStatsLateCollisions
acdPortTxStatsLateCollisions.description: This is a count of the number of packets dropped by this port due to late collisions. A late collision is a collision that occurs after the collision window time (normally 512-bit times). This count does not include packets dropped due to FIFO underflow. Late collisions are not retried.

acdPortTxStatsNormalCollisions.name: acdPortTxStatsNormalCollisions
acdPortTxStatsNormalCollisions.description: This is a count of the total number of normal collisions that have occurred on this port during all transmission attempts. FIFO underflows, late collisions and collisions that occur while this port is not trying to transmit are not counted. This count does not include collisions during half-duplex back pressure.

acdPortTxStatsFifoErrors.name: acdPortTxStatsFifoErrors
acdPortTxStatsFifoErrors.description: This is a count of the number of packets dropped by this port due to an underflow in the transmit FIFO. When an underflow is detected, transmission is immediately aborted after sending a known bad (inverted) CRC sequence. The FIFO underflow error takes precedence over all other errors if this counter is incremented, then none of the other packet type counters are incremented.

acdPortTxStatsPkts64.name: acdPortTxStatsPkts64
acdPortTxStatsPkts64.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, transmitted by this port that were exactly 64 bytes in length (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortTxStatsPkts65to127.name: acdPortTxStatsPkts65to127
acdPortTxStatsPkts65to127.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, transmitted by this port that were 65 to 127 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortTxStatsPkts128to255.name: acdPortTxStatsPkts128to255
acdPortTxStatsPkts128to255.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, transmitted by this port that were 128 to 255 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortTxStatsPkts256to511.name: acdPortTxStatsPkts256to511
acdPortTxStatsPkts256to511.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, transmitted by this port that were 256 to 511 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortTxStatsPkts512to1023.name: acdPortTxStatsPkts512to1023
acdPortTxStatsPkts512to1023.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, transmitted by this port that were 512 to 1023 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortTxStatsPkts1024to1518.name: acdPortTxStatsPkts1024to1518
acdPortTxStatsPkts1024to1518.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, transmitted by this port that were 1024 to 1518 bytes in length (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortTxStatsPkts1519to2047.name: acdPortTxStatsPkts1519to2047
acdPortTxStatsPkts1519to2047.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, transmitted by this port that were 1519 to 2047 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortTxStatsPkts2048to4095.name: acdPortTxStatsPkts2048to4095
acdPortTxStatsPkts2048to4095.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, transmitted by this port that were 2048 to 4095 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortTxStatsPkts4096to8191.name: acdPortTxStatsPkts4096to8191
acdPortTxStatsPkts4096to8191.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, transmitted by this port that were 4096 to 8191 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortTxStatsPkts8192andMore.name: acdPortTxStatsPkts8192andMore
acdPortTxStatsPkts8192andMore.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, transmitted by this port that were greater than 8192 bytes in length (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortTxStatsPktsLarge.name: acdPortTxStatsPktsLarge
acdPortTxStatsPktsLarge.description: The total number of large packets transmitted by this port. Define the size of large packets on the Port configuration.

acdPortRxStatsIndex.name: acdPortRxStatsIndex
acdPortRxStatsIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies this acdPortRxStats entry.

acdPortRxStatsSupportBits.name: acdPortRxStatsSupportBits
acdPortRxStatsSupportBits.description: A value that identifies the set of RX statistics supported by the device. Each bit indicates whether or not the specific statistic value is valid on the system.

acdPortRxStatsBytesGood.name: acdPortRxStatsBytesGood
acdPortRxStatsBytesGood.description: This is a count of the total number of bytes received by the port in good packets. The count includes the 4 CRC bytes but does not include the preamble or SFD bytes. A good packet is a well-formed normally sized packet (64 to maxsize bytes) with good CRC and no PHY or FIFO errors.

acdPortRxStatsBytesTotal.name: acdPortRxStatsBytesTotal
acdPortRxStatsBytesTotal.description: This is a count of the total number of bytes received by the port in good and bad packets. The count includes the 4 CRC bytes (if present) but does not include the preamble or SFD bytes. Good packets are described above. Bad packets include short packets (less than 64 bytes), long packets (greater than maxsize bytes), packets with bad CRC, packets with PHY errors, and packets with receive FIFO errors. Bytes in bad packets resulting from a collision are counted if the SFD is detected.

acdPortRxStatsShortOk.name: acdPortRxStatsShortOk
acdPortRxStatsShortOk.description: This is a count of error-free packets received on this port that are shorter than 64 bytes. A packet is error-free if it has a valid CRC, no PHY errorsand no FIFO errors.

acdPortRxStatsShortBad.name: acdPortRxStatsShortBad
acdPortRxStatsShortBad.description: This is a count of packets received on this port that are shorter than 64 bytes and have a bad CRC. Packets with PHY or FIFO errors are not counted.

acdPortRxStatsLongOk.name: acdPortRxStatsLongOk
acdPortRxStatsLongOk.description: This is a count of error-free packets received on this port that are longer than maxsize bytes. A packet is error-free if it has a valid CRC, no PHY errors and no FIFO errors.

acdPortRxStatsLongBad.name: acdPortRxStatsLongBad
acdPortRxStatsLongBad.description: This is a count of packets received on this port that are longer than 64 bytes and have a bad CRC. Packets with PHY or FIFO errors are not counted.

acdPortRxStatsUnicastPkts.name: acdPortRxStatsUnicastPkts
acdPortRxStatsUnicastPkts.description: This is a count of the good unicast packets received by this port. A good unicast packet is a normally sized packet (64 to maxsize bytes) that is received without error a good CRC, no PHY or FIFO errors. Unicast packets are identified by having a 0 in the least significant bit of the first byte of the destination address (i.e. the first bit received is a 0).

acdPortRxStatsMulticastPkts.name: acdPortRxStatsMulticastPkts
acdPortRxStatsMulticastPkts.description: This is a count of the good multicast packets received by this port. A good multicast packet is a normally sized packet (64 to maxsize bytes) that is received without error, a good CRC, no PHY or FIFO errors. Multicast packets are identified by having a 1 in the least significant bit of the first byte of the destination address (i.e. the first bit received is a 1). Broadcast packets are not included in this count.

acdPortRxStatsBroadcastPkts.name: acdPortRxStatsBroadcastPkts
acdPortRxStatsBroadcastPkts.description: This is a count of the good broadcast packets received by this port. A good broadcast packet is a normally sized packet (64 to maxsize bytes) that is received without error, a good CRC, no PHY or FIFO errors. Broadcast packets are identified by a destination address of all 1's.

acdPortRxStatsPauseFrames.name: acdPortRxStatsPauseFrames
acdPortRxStatsPauseFrames.description: This is a count of the good flow control pause packets received by this port (good CRC, no PHY or FIFO errors, normally sized). Flow control pause packets are identified by a type of 0x8808, and an opcode field of 0x0001.

acdPortRxStatsTaggedFrames.name: acdPortRxStatsTaggedFrames
acdPortRxStatsTaggedFrames.description: This is a count of the good VLAN packets receive by this port (good CRC, no PHY or FIFO errors, normally sized). VLAN packets are identified by a type field equal to 0x8100 in the outer VLAN tag.

acdPortRxStatsCRCErrors.name: acdPortRxStatsCRCErrors
acdPortRxStatsCRCErrors.description: This is a count of normally sized packets (64 to maxsize bytes) received by this port with a CRC error but not a dribbling nibble (packet is an integral number of bytes long). Packets with FIFO or PHY errors are not counted.

acdPortRxStatsAlignErrors.name: acdPortRxStatsAlignErrors
acdPortRxStatsAlignErrors.description: This is a count of normally sized packets (64 to maxsize bytes) received by this port with a CRC error and a dribbling nibble (packet is not an integral number of bytes long). Packets with PHY or FIFO errors are not counted.

acdPortRxStatsRuntFrames.name: acdPortRxStatsRuntFrames
acdPortRxStatsRuntFrames.description: This is a count of the number of receive packets (or events) detected by this port without SDF detection but with carrier assertion. Packets with valid SFD but no data bytes are also counted as runts. After detecting a runt packet, the update of the RxRunts counter is held off until the next valid packet is received. If multiple runt packets occur between valid packets, the RxRunts counter is incremented only once.

acdPortRxStatsLengthErrors.name: acdPortRxStatsLengthErrors
acdPortRxStatsLengthErrors.description: This is a count of the number of good packets received by this port with a length field check error. A length check error occurs when the value in the length field is within the valid range for data length (3-1500 bytes) but does not match the actual data length of the packet. Length field values less than 46 bytes (which corresponds to the minimum legal packet size of 64 bytes) are not checked due to padding.

acdPortRxStatsFalseCRS.name: acdPortRxStatsFalseCRS
acdPortRxStatsFalseCRS.description: This is a count of the number of receive packets (or events) detected by this port with a false carrier (SSD1 not followed by SSD2). After detecting a false carrier, update of the RxFalseCRS counter is held off until the next valid packet is received. If multiple false carrier events occur between valid packets, the RxFalseCRS counter is incremented only once.

acdPortRxStatsPhyErrors.name: acdPortRxStatsPhyErrors
acdPortRxStatsPhyErrors.description: This is a count of the number of packets received by this port with RX_ER asserted during reception (while RX_DV asserted). Packets with a FIFO error are not counted.

acdPortRxStatsFifoErrors.name: acdPortRxStatsFifoErrors
acdPortRxStatsFifoErrors.description: This is a count of the number of receive packets dropped or aborted due to receive FIFO overflow. The FIFO overflow error takes precedence over all other errors - if this counter is incremented, then none of the other packet type counters is incremented.

acdPortRxStatsIgnored.name: acdPortRxStatsIgnored
acdPortRxStatsIgnored.description: This is a count of the number of received packets that have been ignored by this port. A packet is ignored if it violates the programmed preamble rules or it violates the minimum data gap. The preamble rules include long preamble enforcement (greater than 23 nibbles) and pure preamble enforcement (only 55h bytes). The minimum data gap is the time between packet data transfers and is measured from immediately after the last CRC byte of the previous packet through the SFD field of the current packet. The normal data gap is 20 bytes long (12 bytes of IPG and 8 bytes of preamble/SFD). The enforcement limit is set to 10 bytes (half the normal gap length).

acdPortRxStatsBadOpcode.name: acdPortRxStatsBadOpcode
acdPortRxStatsBadOpcode.description: This is a count of the good control packets received by this port (good CRC, no PHY or FIFO errors, normally sized) with an unknown opcode. Unknown control packets are identified by a type field of 88-08 and an opcode field not equal to 00-01.

acdPortRxStatsPkts64.name: acdPortRxStatsPkts64
acdPortRxStatsPkts64.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, received by this port that were exactly 64 bytes in length (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortRxStatsPkts65to127.name: acdPortRxStatsPkts65to127
acdPortRxStatsPkts65to127.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, received by this port that were 65 to 127 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortRxStatsPkts128to255.name: acdPortRxStatsPkts128to255
acdPortRxStatsPkts128to255.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, received by this port that were 128 to 255 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortRxStatsPkts256to511.name: acdPortRxStatsPkts256to511
acdPortRxStatsPkts256to511.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, received by this port that were 256 to 511 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortRxStatsPkts512to1023.name: acdPortRxStatsPkts512to1023
acdPortRxStatsPkts512to1023.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, received by this port that were 512 to 1023 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortRxStatsPkts1024to1518.name: acdPortRxStatsPkts1024to1518
acdPortRxStatsPkts1024to1518.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, received by this port that were 1024 to 1518 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortRxStatsPkts1519to2047.name: acdPortRxStatsPkts1519to2047
acdPortRxStatsPkts1519to2047.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, received by this port that were 1519 to 2047 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortRxStatsPkts2048to4095.name: acdPortRxStatsPkts2048to4095
acdPortRxStatsPkts2048to4095.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, received by this port that were 2048 to 4095 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortRxStatsPkts4096to8191.name: acdPortRxStatsPkts4096to8191
acdPortRxStatsPkts4096to8191.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, received by this port that were 4096 to 8191 bytes in length inclusive (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortRxStatsPkts8192andMore.name: acdPortRxStatsPkts8192andMore
acdPortRxStatsPkts8192andMore.description: The total number of packets, good or bad, received by this port that were greater than 8192 bytes in length (excluding preamble and SFD but including CRC).

acdPortRxStatsPktsLarge.name: acdPortRxStatsPktsLarge
acdPortRxStatsPktsLarge.description: The total number of large packets received by this port. Define the size of large packets on the Port configuration page.

acdPortConfigTableLastChangeTid.name: acdPortConfigTableLastChangeTid
acdPortConfigTableLastChangeTid.description: This is the transaction ID of the last change of the acdPortConfigTable table. If this value is different since the last read this is indicate a table change.

acdPortTidGroup.name: acdPortTidGroup
acdPortTidGroup.description: List of scalars to monitior changes in tables.

acdPortCompliance.name: acdPortCompliance
acdPortCompliance.description: The compliance statement for support of the ACD-PORT-MIB module.
